email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and LOA of 280m. The laycan is 15-20 October. Our starting freight quote is in the low 50s, say $50.75 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit on the higher side. Given the current market, could you consider something in the mid-40s, say $45.50 per metric ton? Also, can we confirm the laycan as 15-20 October? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your position, but $45.50 is a bit tight given the current market conditions. However, I can offer a revised rate of $48.00 per metric ton. The laycan remains 15-20 October. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised offer. $48.00 is still a bit high for us. Could we meet in the middle at $46.75 per metric ton? Also, can we confirm the demurrage rate? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I appreciate your flexibility. We can agree on $46.75 per metric ton. The demurrage rate is $15,000 per day, pro rata. Let’s proceed with the laycan of 15-20 October. I’ll send over the charter party agreement shortly. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, that sounds good. Please send over the charter party agreement, and we’ll review it promptly. Looking forward to finalizing this shipment. Best, John
